means: 使发生了，造成了（尤指变化）
（使）工作( work的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The small churchyard was surrounded by a rusted wrought-iron fence.
sentence.Network_cn: 不大的教堂墓地周边围着一圈生锈的熟铁栅栏。

sentence.Network_en: The rattan and wrought-iron chair pictured here costs £125.
sentence.Network_cn: 这张图片中的铁艺藤椅要价125英镑。

sentence.Network_en: This century wrought major changes in our society.
sentence.Network_cn: 本世纪给我们的社会带来了重大变革。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: archaic past and past participle of work

entry.def: If something has wrought a change, it has made it happen.

example.ex: Events in Paris wrought a change in British opinion towards France and Germany.
example.tran: 巴黎发生的事件改变了英国对法国和德国的看法。

entry.tran: 以…原料制造的;以…方式制作的
entry.def: If something is wrought in a particular material or in a particular way, it has been created in that material or way.

example.ex: ...a walking stick with a gold head wrought in the form of a flower.

means.word_mean: 1. shaped to fit by or as if by altering the contours of a pliable mass (as by work or effort);

auth_sentence.content: Finely wrought, then, yet instantly forgettable.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Finely wrought, then, yet instantly forgettable.

auth_sentence.content: Those changes were wrought in a scant ten thousand years.
auth_sentence.res_content: Those changes were wrought in a scant ten thousand years.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Those changes were wrought in a scant ten thousand years.

auth_sentence.content: Witness the devastation wrought lately on our own catwalk credentials.

means.word_mean: 制造的;加工的;经装饰的

sentences.en: a bridge made of wrought iron
The steel roof has been coloured to match the finish of the original wrought iron.
sentences.cn: 钢屋顶上了色，以便和原先的锻铁外观相搭配。
